result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Larson II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within 60 days (3/12/18) unless a payment plan has been established.
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall undergo and follow through with any counseling or treatment as recommended by Agent.

15CF262, 15CT259, 17CF344 & 17CM8: Defendant Brian K. Larson in court, in custody with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Br. 1 will disose of all 4 cases; Court reviews recomm.; 15CF262 now amended to 3 Misd. Theft charges, 15CT259 to be D&RI; plead to Counts 2,3 & 8 of 17CF34 (reset D&RI) and plead to Counts 1 & 2 of 17CM8; victim rights complied with; Court reviews charges/penalties in 15CF262 as amended; Def. pleads NC to Misd. Theft in Counts 1, 2 & 3 of 15CF262; Court reviews charge/penalties in Counts 2, 3 & 8 of 17CF344; Def. pleads NC to Misd. BJ in Count 2, Poss. of DP in Count 3 and Misd. BJ in Count 8 of 17CF344; Court reviews charges/penalties in 17CM8; Def. pleads NC to Retail Theft-Int. Take/PTC in Counts 1 & 2 of 17CM8; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; stip. to facts; Court finds pleas made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of 3 counts of Misd. Retail Theft in 15CF262, in 17CF344 - guilty of Count 2 Misd. BJ, Count 3 Poss. of DP and Count 8 Misd. BJ w/all remaining charges D&RI; guilty of both counts of Retail Theft-Int. Take/PTC in 17CM8, 15CT259 is D&RI; State heard - this will be plea hearing only and have these cases track with 18CF18 for disposition with that case; Court will not put off sentencing, will sentence today; Atty. Kline heard; Def. makes statement; Court imposes sentence; Court orders 111 days credit

Plea/sentencing hearing on January 10, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

Calls cases 15CF262, 15CF388, 15CT259, 17CF344, 17CM8. Atty Tienstra appears for cases 15CT259 and 15CF262. Attorney Kurt Klomberg appears in court for cases 15CF388, 17CF344, and 17CM8. Defendant Brian K. Larson in court, in custody with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Atty Klein heard on status - 15CF262, 15CF388 will be proceeding to trial and dates have already been set, motion to modify bail has been filed in 17CF344 but is a branch 4 case. Atty Klomberg does not object to this court hearing the motion. Court will hear bail motion today. Atty Klein heard on motion to modify bail in case 17CF344. Atty Klomberg heard on motion - requests bail remain as is. Atty Klein heard. Court heard and denies motion to modify bail.

8:42. (15cf262/15ct259) Defendant, Brian K. Larson, in court.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft is eligible for SPD.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JW or his residence.   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

9:01 - 15CF262 & 15CT259 - Defendant, Brian K. Larson in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at victim's residence.   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
